<a id="ResourceSaver"></a>

# ResourceSaver

**Inherits:** [Object](Object.md)

A singleton for saving [Resource](Resource.md)\\ s to the filesystem.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A singleton for saving resource types to the filesystem.

It uses the many [ResourceFormatSaver](ResourceFormatSaver.md) classes registered in the engine (either built-in or from a plugin) to save resource data to text-based (e.g. ``.tres`` or ``.tscn``) or binary files (e.g. ``.res`` or ``.scn``).

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

flags **SaverFlags**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_ResourceSaver_SaverFlags)

<a id="ResourceSaver_constant_FLAG_NONE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SaverFlags](ResourceSaver.md#enum_ResourceSaver_SaverFlags) **FLAG_NONE** = `0`

No resource saving option.<a id="ResourceSaver_constant_FLAG_RELATIVE_PATHS"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SaverFlags](ResourceSaver.md#enum_ResourceSaver_SaverFlags) **FLAG_RELATIVE_PATHS** = `1`

Save the resource with a path relative to the scene which uses it.<a id="ResourceSaver_constant_FLAG_BUNDLE_RESOURCES"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SaverFlags](ResourceSaver.md#enum_ResourceSaver_SaverFlags) **FLAG_BUNDLE_RESOURCES** = `2`

Bundles external resources.<a id="ResourceSaver_constant_FLAG_CHANGE_PATH"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SaverFlags](ResourceSaver.md#enum_ResourceSaver_SaverFlags) **FLAG_CHANGE_PATH** = `4`

Changes the [Resource.resource_path](Resource.md#Resource_property_resource_path) of the saved resource to match its new location.<a id="ResourceSaver_constant_FLAG_OMIT_EDITOR_PROPERTIES"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SaverFlags](ResourceSaver.md#enum_ResourceSaver_SaverFlags) **FLAG_OMIT_EDITOR_PROPERTIES** = `8`

Do not save editor-specific metadata (identified by their ``__editor`` prefix).<a id="ResourceSaver_constant_FLAG_SAVE_BIG_ENDIAN"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SaverFlags](ResourceSaver.md#enum_ResourceSaver_SaverFlags) **FLAG_SAVE_BIG_ENDIAN** = `16`

Save as big endian (see [FileAccess.big_endian](FileAccess.md#FileAccess_property_big_endian)).<a id="ResourceSaver_constant_FLAG_COMPRESS"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SaverFlags](ResourceSaver.md#enum_ResourceSaver_SaverFlags) **FLAG_COMPRESS** = `32`

Compress the resource on save using [FileAccess.COMPRESSION_ZSTD](FileAccess.md#FileAccess_constant_COMPRESSION_ZSTD). Only available for binary resource types.<a id="ResourceSaver_constant_FLAG_REPLACE_SUBRESOURCE_PATHS"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SaverFlags](ResourceSaver.md#enum_ResourceSaver_SaverFlags) **FLAG_REPLACE_SUBRESOURCE_PATHS** = `64`

Take over the paths of the saved subresources (see [Resource.take_over_path()](Resource.md#Resource_method_take_over_path)).<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="ResourceSaver_method_add_resource_format_saver"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **add_resource_format_saver**\ (\ format_saver\: [ResourceFormatSaver](ResourceFormatSaver.md), at_front\: [bool](bool.md) = false\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ResourceSaver_method_add_resource_format_saver)

Registers a new [ResourceFormatSaver](ResourceFormatSaver.md). The ResourceSaver will use the ResourceFormatSaver as described in [save()](ResourceSaver.md#ResourceSaver_method_save).

This method is performed implicitly for ResourceFormatSavers written in GDScript (see [ResourceFormatSaver](ResourceFormatSaver.md) for more information).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ResourceSaver_method_get_recognized_extensions"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[PackedStringArray](PackedStringArray.md) **get_recognized_extensions**\ (\ type\: [Resource](Resource.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ResourceSaver_method_get_recognized_extensions)

Returns the list of extensions available for saving a resource of a given type.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ResourceSaver_method_get_resource_id_for_path"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_resource_id_for_path**\ (\ path\: [String](String.md), generate\: [bool](bool.md) = false\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ResourceSaver_method_get_resource_id_for_path)

Returns the resource ID for the given path. If `generate` is ``true``, a new resource ID will be generated if one for the path is not found. If `generate` is ``false`` and the path is not found, [ResourceUID.INVALID_ID](ResourceUID.md#ResourceUID_constant_INVALID_ID) is returned.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ResourceSaver_method_remove_resource_format_saver"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **remove_resource_format_saver**\ (\ format_saver\: [ResourceFormatSaver](ResourceFormatSaver.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ResourceSaver_method_remove_resource_format_saver)

Unregisters the given [ResourceFormatSaver](ResourceFormatSaver.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ResourceSaver_method_save"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **save**\ (\ resource\: [Resource](Resource.md), path\: [String](String.md) = "", flags\: **BitField**\[[SaverFlags](ResourceSaver.md#enum_ResourceSaver_SaverFlags)\] = 0\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ResourceSaver_method_save)

Saves a resource to disk to the given path, using a [ResourceFormatSaver](ResourceFormatSaver.md) that recognizes the resource object. If `path` is empty, **ResourceSaver** will try to use [Resource.resource_path](Resource.md#Resource_property_resource_path).

The `flags` bitmask can be specified to customize the save behavior.

Returns [@GlobalScope.OK](@GlobalScope.md#@GlobalScope_constant_OK) on success.

\ **Note:** When the project is running, any generated UID associated with the resource will not be saved as the required code is only executed in editor mode.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ResourceSaver_method_set_uid"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **set_uid**\ (\ resource\: [String](String.md), uid\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ResourceSaver_method_set_uid)

Sets the UID of the given `resource` path to `uid`. You can generate a new UID using [ResourceUID.create_id()](ResourceUID.md#ResourceUID_method_create_id).

Since resources will normally get a UID automatically, this method is only useful in very specific cases.
